oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with an interview showing Junior McCormick’s swollen hand as he talks about his bite to the interviewer. The video cuts to a service which is opened by Spencer Evans. Who preaches and takes prayer requests. As Billy Lemming starts to play, Carl Porter speaks and lets the congregation know that despite Junior McCormick’s bite, he is present. Music follows his brief speech and Bill Pelfrey leads the congregation in song as congregants keep rhythm. The video cuts from the music to Pelfrey calling for praise as a new song begins and John Wayne Jr. “Punkin” Brown Jr. sings and plays guitar. Shortly thereafter, Joel Sherbert, Gene Sherbert, Spencer Evans, Carl Porter and Junior McCormick handle serpents. Lydia Hollins follows John Wayne "Punkin" Brown Jr. and sings. As she does, elders of the church lay hands on members and pray over them. Lydia Hollins finishes her song and Carl Porter begins the next, which is led by Spencer Evans as Bill Pelfrey dances. Carl Porter preaches to the congregation. It is followed by another song and when it is complete, the singer asks the congregation to pray for a member who is not present. Other members sing and in the background, there is more imposition of hands by elders of the church. Spencer Evans, who drinks strychnine, receives the imposition of hands speaks to the congregation as the music plays. More dancing, singing and imposition of hands follows. A woman lies on the floor, slain in spirit. Spencer Evans testifies and preaches. He talks about drinking strychnine and handling serpents. Carl Porter follows him and calls others to testify. One woman does. After this, John Wayne Jr. “Punkin” Brown Jr. preaches. Testimony from other congregants follows.
